page.title: 08Abbotsley pond and Sign
page.content: Hutchin's pond is near Rectory farm. It used to be called the village watering place when the horses used to come off the field and rinse their feet to make them clean again. Today it is one of the village beauty spots. A man has made a duck house and he has put it in the pond to stop the fox getting the ducks.The children often go down to Hutchin's pond to feed the ducks.It's got a thatched roof it came from one of the thatched houses in the village.Another interesting sight in the village is the village sign It has four kings on it,because the church has four kings on the tower.Some of the money to pay for the sign was raised by coffee evenings held at Church farm.It was unveiled by Mrs. Flint because she is the oldest person in the village. (continued on page 9)
